Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jennnnnnnnnnnifer
Reviews.Content: It's situated at a good location, very accessible with train station so nearby and there are many good food available nearby which are operated till very late. Ate at a korean restaurant superK along tanjong pagar rd, they served very good Bbq food. After dinner went to fluffy dessert for dessert and they serve very nice snow ice with fruits. Perfect for me as the weather in sg is very hot! Head back to orchid hotel just walking distance. Enjoyed my stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Is anyone there?”
Reviews.Author: HK_G_24
Reviews.Content: I would have given this hotel a "very good" rating if it wasn't for one small but crucial thing: nobody picked up the phone. Trying to minimise roaming expenses, my husband tried calling me on the land line on numerous occasions only to listen to the phone either ring out, or to be diverted to a voice mail that said "Sorry, but this line is currently not available" (!!!). Yes, that was their main outside phone line. When he finally was able to get someone (and he wasn't always lucky I might add), when he asked to speak to me he was told that a person with that name wasn't staying in the hotel. Only when he gave my room number was he finally put through. But even when I tried to ring the front desk from my room, it simply rang out. When I told the front desk (in person), they didn't seem too concerned. How can you get something so incredibly simple, but equally vital, so wrong? The location is great, the rooms are big (albeit with very old fashioned deco), the pool is beautiful. But if they can't answer the phone, I won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: alior s
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located. Close to the Maxwell foodcourt and to Chinatown. The room was big and nice. Pretty big bathroom with a nice view on the buildings. Furniture is very strandard and does not have a lot of style. Pretty much the same kind of stuff you would find in every hotel of the world. Breakfast is ok, the choicie is broad enough. Nice pool located in front of the restaurant so that everyone can watch you swimming ! Wifi works well. Staff is ok but does not speak very well english. But they do work well.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: MLR84
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel mid-March 2012 for 5 days. Although I had read mostly excellent reviews about it, the staff didn’t make a good first impression. I contacted the hotel on 2 occasions (via the Agoda booking form as well as via email) prior to my arrival with an early check-in request (seeing that I would be on a 13 hour flight), but didn’t receive a response within the first two weeks. It was only after calling them, that I received a reply, in which they noted that early check-in is subject to room availability and that I could ensure that my room was available by booking the night before against the full daily rate. Although I can understand that this might be hotel policy, I found it hard to believe that all 254 deluxe rooms would have been booked, so I decided to take my chances. I arrived in the hotel around 7am and was indeed told that my room wasn’t ready yet and that I had to wait in the lobby. The reception staff apologized for the inconvenience and offered me free bottled water. It was only until around 10 am however, that they were able to check me-in, and this was only because I insisted that a room should be available now as I had just seen someone check out 15 min before. It’s also good to know, that they ask for a 50SGD guarantee on your credit card. This is just in case you use something from the minibar (which was only stocked with Tiger beer, coca cola and sprite I might add). Although there are two free bottles of mineral water in the room (restocked daily). Finally in my room, I noticed that I had accidentally left behind my camera. The good thing was that the manager handled this issue swiftly and efficiently. As it turns out, I had left behind my camera in the elevator and the manager returned it to me himself within less than 10 min. My room (1513) was clean, big and spacious with a light décor. The bathroom only had a shower, but was very clean and extremely spacious as well, with great water pressure and an adjustable showerhead. The room also had a very beautiful skyline view over Singapore. Housekeeping did an excellent job. Every time I went out and switched on the please make up room button, the room was swiftly cleaned and toiletries were fully restocked when I got back in I had booked a deluxe room promo with free wifi. I was able to go online, but the connection seemed excruciatingly slow during, what may have been, certain peak hours. There’s a small gym, sauna and swimming pool on the 3rd floor, which are all open from 7am-9pm, which I thought was a definite plus. There’s also a restaurant/ café on the third floor, which offers an American as well as Continental breakfast, against reasonable prices (around 17 SGD). Another pro is the excellent location, within a 5 min walking distance from Tanjong Pagar MRT and several shops (incl. 7-eleven, supermarket and a small fruit market). The staff effiency/service can really be improved on though. I had booked a day tour with an 8 am pickup. Having waited 10 min. in my room, I decided to go down to the lobby and inform the reception desk that I was expecting someone from a tour agency. It was only then that they informed me that the driver was already waiting outside! A call to my room would have been nice though. All in all, I would rate this hotel as average. They have got a lot going for them, but at the same time there is definitely room for improvement. I did like the nice atmosphere. I really got the feeling that they respected my privacy (staff was very friendly without being too pushy).

Reviews.Title: “Wall is thin”
Reviews.Author: MJFORFUN
Reviews.Content: All the previous comments about the hotel are true, good value, large room, clean and convenient but the wall is thin, if your neighbor is loud you could hear their conversation as most of the rooms are connecting. Stayed there three nights, on the second night was awaken at 1:30 am by my neighbor who just checked in. Luckily they checked out the next day. BTW, asked for a bottle opener on the third night and been told they do not have any despite there is an in-house restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, convenient for business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: CarTraveller13
Reviews.Content: The Orchid hotel is a new hotel in the Tajong Pagar area. The rooms are big, the bathroom a delight and the bed & pillows so comfortable. The hotel is across the road from markets, hawker food stalls, restaurants and shops. Less than 100 metres away is the entrance to the MRT station and from there Singapore is accessible. A very easy walk to Chinatown. Combined a business trip with a few leisure nights and had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “On the doorstep of the MRT and Chinatown - excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Crooked Nose
Reviews.Content: The Orchid is right on Tajong Pagar MRT station which provides easy access throughout Singapore and and a one, easy change link to Changi Airport. The staff are very professional and rooms are spacious,well-appointed and decorated.Singapore can be expensive for hotel accomodation and I believe the Orchid represents very commendable value for money.There is a swimming pool,sauna and small gym on the 3rd floor. Chinatown is only a few minutes walk away and downtown a short trip away by MRT.Get yourself a NETS card and explore the city. The justly famous Maxwell Food Centre is a stroll up the street and if local food at super prices is high on your list,as it always is on mine - The Orchid may be just the hotel you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money..very pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Bruce H
Reviews.Content: I stayed this week for a couple of nights at the Orchid Hotel. I was very satisfied with the value for money. The hotel premises were impeccably clean, modern and well maintained. The pool was beautiful and perfect for lap swimming. The staff (special mention Jasmine, lovely smile) were very friendly and helpful. The fitness room, which I didn't get a chance to use, appeared to be very modern and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rasputin1309
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel and it was a pleasant enough stay. I stayed January 5th to January 9th. I have previously stayed in the Amara hotel which is just around the corner, (both are around 3 minutes walk from Tanjong Pagar MRT station) and was a little concerned when I found out I was staying in the Orchid due to some renovations being undertaken at the Amara. The Orchid is considerably smaller than the Amara and nowhere near as "grand". However, it is perfectly adequate for a short stay. The staff are friendly and the rooms large and modern, (the hotel is new!) The swimming pool is nice - an open air terrace pool and the gym whilst very small, (just 1 treadmill, a stairmaster, and a bike and some weights), is perfectly adequate - I was the only person in there on each of the four occasions I used it. Where the hotel does not score well is with their breakfasts. They are quite frankly rather poor. If you want western food, there are some fried eggs which typically are cold, some scrambled eggs and some croissants/pastries. The selection of pastries is very small. For more eastern food, there are some noodles, (rather greasy) and some rice which is quite nice and one or two other bits and bobs. The juice is not freshly squeezed but rather tastes as if it is from concentrate. The food is ok for a short stay but if I was staying any longer than a week then it would get painfully monotonous - and as I suggested the quality of the food is not great either, (at least at breakfast - I did not try lunch or dinner). The location of the hotel is great - so close to the MRT station and a short walk into Chinatown and apparently the price is just about half that of the Amara. A made to order omlette bar would be a great addition to the breakfasts and would be relatively inexpensive to add too. I'd be happy to go back but not for a long stay.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money; great location; very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: SumiRD
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights with 5 adults and 1 toddler. The best part of the hotel were the rooms, very new therefore very nice and comfortable. We had connecting rooms. Everything in the room was clean and new.The pool was closed at the time of our visit, but from the looks of it, is very basic. The buffet breakfast would probably suite the Asian palate very well - we enjoyed it tremendously. The hotel staff was kind and very helpful, although some of them were not native English speakers.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: illuminatus14
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel during a recent trip to Singapore with a bunch of my colleagues from around the region. We were initially underwhelmed, as the hotel certainly did not give the impression of being very classy and the reception staff were not very welcoming and didn't speak very good English either. The bellboy was fine though. The room however was a pleasant surprise. It was of course clean, being a new hotel and all, but it was also modern looking and comfortable. The bathroom flooring was the most interesting aspect, as the tiles appeared to be made of leather and were really nice to walk on as they are soft and don't get cold. Beds were decent, if not outstanding, but for the price it was good enough. Internet service provided was adequate if not blazing fast. The breakfast was awful though, not much to choose from and most of the Asian dishes were extremely salty to the point of being inedible. Definitely skip this. All in all, the positives for Orchid Hotel are its proximity to the MRT as well as its comfortable rooms. Negative points would be the breakfast and the reception staff. One of my colleagues had a great deal of difficulty communicating with them as he was trying to check out, so that definitely needs improvement. In conclusion - decent option for a mid-sized budget.
